results.title: It needn't happen
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Warns against accidents to small children in the home through the example of a little girl, the accidents that might have happened and how they could be prevented. Boiling water, medicine and sharp objects left within reach of the child, and over-boisterous games are all potentially dangerous.

results.title: Island target
results.creator_credit: Ralph Smart and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The story of one squadron of Australian airmen in action against the Japanese in the islands north of Australia. The work of the squadron included the covering of Allied landings and a hazardous attack on Japanese headquarteres on one particular island.

results.title: Is it always right to be right?
results.creator_credit: Lee Mishkin, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: This fast moving parable, designed to provoke discussion without alienating any group, highlights the centres of divisiveness in our society, the generation gap, poverty, war and race. It tells of a land “where men were always right”. This animated film is a winner of many awards including an Academy Award. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: Is anybody doing anything about it?
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A dramatised introduction to the work of the Bureau of Meteorology, showing how weather information is collected and used for reports and predictions, with impressions of the importance of the weather in various industries. Shows how at the Southern Hemisphere Analysis Centre in Melbourne, synoptic charts are drawn up by computers. A global weather pattern can be seen every six hours. Cast features Carmen Duncan and Tom Oliver.

results.title: The Invisible link
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, Geoffrey Collings, Stanley Hawes and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A brief explanation of radio broadcasting in Australia. Shows scenes in the Australian Broadcasting Commission’s studios and in the Postmaster-General’s transmission stations through which typical commercial and non-commercial programs are being broadcast. Use of wireless in ships, aeroplanes, police cars and ambulances, including a symphony concert, a radio play and the children’s “Kindergarten of the Air”.

results.title: An Introduction to motor cycling
results.creator_credit: Tony Hansen, Peter Johnson, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Inexperience, unpreparedness, and a powerful machine, are al1 factors which cause motor cycle accidents, and contribute to an awful and unnecessary waste. Points out the different types of motor cycles appropriate to different individuals, purposes and situations, as well as explaining how a motor cycle works.

results.title: The International Court of Justice
results.creator_credit: Karl Van der Ploeg, Janine Hamel-Minne and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: The origin of the concept of international law and the evolvement of the role of the International Court of Justice in the Hague, in deciding legal disputes between States. Its work and function are illustrated in the controversy between Norway and the United Kingdom concerning fishing rights, the disputed frontier land between Belgium and the Netherlands, and the dispute between Cambodia and Thailand regarding the territorial sovereignty of a holy monastery.

results.title: Inspecting the car
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “How to Drive”.
Good driving depends on good habits and a quick daily inspection as well as regular maintenance of those items which directly affect safety is the first good habit to develop. Demonstrates a quick and easy method of checking items, by starting at the driver’s door and walking anti-clockwise around the car.

results.title: In song and dance
results.creator_credit: Don Saunders, Lee Robinson, Joy Cavill, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Waratah Film Productions
results.brief_description: The preparations and some scenes of the 1964 Northern Territory Eisteddfod held at Darwin. Local townspeople are joined by cattlemen and aborigines from far out stations, and get together to produce an eisteddfod unlike any other - with items of all kinds, from classical ballet to Aboriginal corroborees.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Saunders, Lee Robinson, Joy Cavill, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Waratah Film Productions
